alert.note: Alert for Woodward (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 11:13PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Woodward County through 1145 PM CDT... At 1113 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mooreland, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woodward, Mooreland, Sharon and Quinlan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
